greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) is defined as follows. Write the numbers from 1 to n^2 consecutively in n rows of length n; T(n,k) = number of primes in k-th row.
comment: Sum(T(n,k): 1<=k<=n) = A038107(n); T(n,1)=A000720(n); T(n,2)=A060715(n) for n>1. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jan 07 2004
reference: Paulo Ribenboim, "The Little Book Of Big Primes," Springer-Verlag, NY 1991, page 185.
link: T. D. Noe, Rows n=1..100 of triangle, flattened
program: a083415_row n = f n a010051_list where
f k chips = (sum chin) : f (k - 1) chips' where
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, following a suggestion of _Wouter Meeussen_, Jun 10 2003
